body_html:
In my setup, I started with ./grpc_tensorflow_server --cluster_spec='worker|10.201.106.12:2222;10.201.106.11:2222' --job_name=worker --task_index=0 and the other with 0 replaced by 1. Is there any problem with the way I fire the servers? Why couldn't I place explicitly on the remote host?

Thanks
body_text:
In my setup, I started with ./grpc_tensorflow_server --cluster_spec='worker|10.201.106.12:2222;10.201.106.11:2222' --job_name=worker --task_index=0 and the other with 0 replaced by 1. Is there any problem with the way I fire the servers? Why couldn't I place explicitly on the remote host?

body:
In my setup, I started with `./grpc_tensorflow_server --cluster_spec='worker|10.201.106.12:2222;10.201.106.11:2222' --job_name=worker --task_index=0` and the other with 0 replaced by 1. Is there any problem with the way I fire the servers? Why couldn't I place explicitly on the remote host?

Thanks
